subject: Coaches and Managers
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Clemson upgraded Dabo Swinney from interim coach, giving him a five-year contract to replace Tommy Bowden. Swinney’s salary and possible incentives in the deal will not be released until the contract is approved by the university’s Board of Trustees Compensation Committee. Swinney took over as interim coach Oct. 13 after Bowden resigned. The Tigers won four of their final five games under Swinney to become bowl eligible.
